The RPV is typically fabricated from ASME SA508 Class 3 steel
6– 8 . With the development of generation IV reactors, larger and higher-power nuclear power plants (compared with those housing generation III reactors) are being built. However, the low strength (620 MPa) of the SA508 Class 3 steel renders this material unsuitable for generation IV reactors and, hence, new materials must be developed. Many countries have considered SA508Gr.4N steel as a candidate material
9, 10 .
